definition: A measure of the acidity or alkalinity of the soil.
description: Soil pH is a master variable in soil science that affects the availability of nutrients, microbial activity, and plant growth. It ranges from 0 to 14, with 7 being neutral.

definition: The volume of open spaces (pores) in a material.
description: In soil science, porosity determines the water-holding capacity and aeration of the soil. It is inversely related to bulk density.

definition: The amount of dissolved oxygen needed by aerobic biological organisms to break down organic material.
description: BOD is a critical metric in water quality management. High BOD indicates high levels of organic pollution, which can deplete oxygen and harm aquatic life.

definition: A property of vascular plants, soils and rocks, that describes the ease with which a fluid (usually water) can move through pore spaces or fractures.
description: It depends on the intrinsic permeability of the material and the degree of saturation, and on the density and viscosity of the fluid.

definition: Excessive richness of nutrients in a lake or other body of water.
description: Frequently due to runoff from the land, which causes a dense growth of plant life and death of animal life from lack of oxygen.

definition: The total capacity of a soil to hold exchangeable cations.
description: CEC is an inherent soil characteristic and is difficult to alter significantly. It influences the soil's ability to hold onto essential nutrients and provides a buffer against soil acidification.

definition: An equation that describes the flow of a fluid through a porous medium.
description: Investigated by Henry Darcy, it is a foundation of hydrogeology.

definition: mass of soil solid over total volume of soil
formula: \rho_b = \frac{\text{mass of soil solid}}{\text{total volume of soil}}

definition: Ratio of runoff depth to precipitation depth.
The fraction of the total soil volume that is taken up by the pore space.
description: It is a critical property affecting the movement of air and water in the soil.

definition: The ratio of water volume to soil volume.
description: Used to describe the amount of water stored in the soil profile.

definition: The mass of water per unit mass of dry soil.
description: Standard method for measuring soil moisture in the lab.

definition: Describes the flow of a fluid through a porous medium.
Calculates the settling velocity of particles in suspension.
description: Used in particle size analysis (texture) of soils.

definition: Predicts the long-term average annual rate of erosion on a field slope.
description: Widely used model for soil conservation planning.
formula: A = R \cdot K \cdot LS \cdot C \cdot P

definition: A measure of the suitability of water for use in agricultural irrigation.
The percentage of the CEC occupied by basic cations.
Metabolic process of organisms producing energy.
The change in total head with a change in distance in a given direction.
The ratio of the volume of voids to the volume of solids.
The ratio of the volume of water to the volume of voids.
description: Indicates how wet the soil is.

definition: Empirical formula for open channel flow.
description: Calculates velocity of water in channels.

definition: Process used by plants to convert light energy into chemical energy.
A measure of acidity or alkalinity.
description: Logarithmic scale of hydrogen ion concentration.

definition: Combined content of calcium and magnesium.
The proportion of the incident light or radiation that is reflected by a surface.
Relates the attenuation of light to the properties of the material through which the light is traveling.
Equation of state of a hypothetical ideal gas.
description: Approximation for behavior of many gases.

definition: Ratio of mass of carbon to mass of nitrogen in a substance.
The percentage of the CEC occupied by sodium.
Volume of soil not occupied by solids.
Yield of plant product per unit of crop water use.
Dimensionless quantity predicting flow patterns.
Ratio of the weight of a volume of soil to the weight of an equal volume of water.
Percentage change in length of a soil sample upon wetting.
Chemical reaction creating ozone in stratosphere.
Loss of nitrogen as ammonia gas.
Biological oxidation of ammonia to nitrite followed by oxidation of nitrite to nitrate.
Microbial reduction of nitrate to nitrogen gas.
Depth of water falling per unit time.
Estimates peak discharge from a small watershed.
Total surface area of soil particles per unit mass.
Height to which water rises in a small pore.
formula_description:
g = Gravitational force
r = Radius of the Tube
